COMMENT_TX: Jewel Ens continued to act as manager in the absence of Donie Bush who found it necessary to remain at his home in Indianapolis where his aged mother is ill.  Her nerves were badly shattered by the shock that followed the death of another son, Michael, who was killed last week in an auto collision.
Close play at 1B on GDP attempt
Beck knocked down hot one back of 3B
Grimes drew a loud outburst of applause
No throw; stole on the 1st pitch
Jones threw home; English was trapped but returned to 3B safely.
Hit & run; Stephenson beat Bartell to 2B
Off the facing of the RF extension
Jones toppled over backward after making good catch

Stephenson's take-out slide forced an errant throw to 1B, but Hargreaves backed it up when it rebounded from the stand and ran to 1B.  Grimm had run past 1B and turned toward 2B, but was tagged out by the catcher while trying to get back to 1B.
Grimm watched the 3rd one hook over and objected to Ump Moran's call.

Both runners started to run on a short PB.  Bartell scooted back to 3B when Schulte made a quick recovery, but Hemsley was run down.  Bartell then scored before English could peg to the plate in time.
Hornsby was trapped and run down
Bounder caromed off Fussell's glove to Jones
Bottomley fell while making a fine stop and tossed out the batter while flat on his back.
Lined out after a fusilade of foul balls
Bartell knocked down drive over 2B and trapped Dressen off 1B.  Kelly tried to score on the rundown but was run down himself.
Grimes injured his hand when he broke down Gooch's smash but remained on the mound.
After Wilson's SF, Swetonic went to the bench to get treatment for a blister on a finger of his right hand that had broke open.
Hot The attendance, estimated at 25,000, was believed to have smashed all NL records for a morning game attendance.
P.Waner: spectacular 1-handed leaping catch off wall in front of RF stand.
P.Waner: another clever catch close to the same wall

Sheely fielded it but nobody covered 1B

Against the top of the exit gate in RCF
Threw wild and low past Sheely
L.Waner tried to score when P.Waner was trapped between 1B & 2B on the throw-in.
Grantham had flied out to Wilson, but Ump Hart ruled Schulte tipped his bat, so Grantham was awarded 1B.  Cub manager McCarthy kicked so vigorously that he was ejected by Hart.
Stretched a single by splendid leg work
Schulte threw into CF, but error charged to Hornsby for not covering 2B.

Hit on the left wrist; Dodgers argued heatedly for 5 minutes that Bartell made no effort to elude the pitch.
Ump McCormick ruled diving catch a trap

Originally, Herman tagged up and made it to 2B on the apparent sacrifice fly to deep CF. Pirates Mgr Bush claimed Herman left 1B early.  Ump McCormick, who called Herman safe at 2B, conferred with Ump Reardon who upheld Bush's claim and Herman was declared out. The Pirates kicked on the decision and Ump Reardon ejected Dazzy Vance for talking too much.

Bunted a high one over Hubbell's head

Bounced on top of the scoreboard and over it

Grantham failed to cover 2B, allowing the perfect throw to go into CF.

Ott scored when P.Waner threw to 2B; Terry advanced when Jones threw home.
Sheely was hit by the batted ball; scoring?
Pirates argued close decision at 3B on Roush
Lindstrom threw into the grandstand. The crowd, anticipating the final out on the play, poured onto the field, delaying the game by 5 minutes.
L.Waner: good running catch of low liner
Against the front of RF stand; 'dented the concrete in front of the extension'.

Knocked aside by Grantham; ball rolled to the grass. He chased it and trapped Frisch rounding 1B.

Frederick made a desperate 1-handed shoestring effort but it bounded by him.
Fluke double; Grantham and P.Waner collided going after the pop fly.  Both players were injured: Waner (bruised left leg and right arm); Grantham (same shoulder hurt 3 weeks ago).

Ordinary single that skidded through Welsh's legs and rolled far back to the CF wall.
Into RF stands, his 5th HR in four afternoons (#33)
Liner struck Koupal under the belt but he held on.  Time was called for a physician to examine him for possible injury.

Into the rear wing of the RF stands. Hurst's last 6 hits have all been HRs, which was believed to be a record at the time.

Into RF stands. A big argument stopped the game.  Ump Rigler apparently allowed a single on the ball but, after an argument from the Giants, he consulted with the umpire at 1B (Jorda) who allowed a HR.  Jorda was in a better position to judge the ball which bounded back onto the playing field after hitting in the stands.
Into the deep section of RF stands
Kremer was originally chosen to start for Pittsburgh but came down with a stomach ailment prior to the game.
Paul Waner was benched for 'lack of hitting', in hope a rest may benefit his batting eye.

Weather: cool Jewel Ens was named acting PIT manager today following the the resignation of Donie Bush.
